page.title: 01East Markham District Notts
page.content: East and Wst Markham lie either side of a Keuper Marl Ridge. Undulating countryside flows from the higher area with heavy clay land larely devoted to arable farming. Main crops are sugar beet and rape, determined by EEc subsidies. Some rough grassland exists adjacent to farms where sheep and cattle graze lesser quantities of wheat and barley are grown. East markham has substantial apple orchards. As agriculture has become more mechanised some residential property has been taken over by professional people with no immediate interests, and by workers at a nearby colliery, and the trentside power stations. There is some recent residential develpment in East Markham itself, othe wise the area has changed but little ove the century. Askham and west markham are farm based
